title: 114_hr3863
content: The "Disaster Assistance Equity Act of 2015" may be cited as such. It includes definitions for various terms. The "Disaster Assistance Equity Act of 2015" introduces new definitions related to private nonprofit facilities and common interest communities, expanding the scope of facilities eligible for disaster relief assistance. The curr_chunk describes an organization consisting of real estate owners who are obligated to pay for various expenses related to common elements or other units. It also includes definitions related to condominium projects with detached single family units or multi-unit housing structures. The curr_chunk defines a condominium as a multi-unit housing project where each unit is separately owned, with common areas owned by all unit owners through a condominium association responsible for operation. The curr_chunk defines a housing cooperative as a multi-unit housing project where each dwelling unit is owned by cooperative members through a cooperative association responsible for operation. SEC. 3. CONDOMINIUMS AND HOUSING COOPERATIVES DAMAGED BY A MAJOR DISASTER. Section 408(b)(1) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to include condominiums and housing cooperatives in the Individuals and Households Program for financial assistance. The maximum amount of assistance under this Act is also addressed in Section 408(h). The Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to allow condominiums and housing cooperatives to receive financial assistance under the Individuals and Households Program. The maximum amount of assistance for these entities in a single disaster will be determined by the President annually. The amendments made by this Act apply to disasters declared by the President under the Stafford Act after the enactment date.
